content:
Hi,

I'm new here so I hope this is the right place to ask. I'm setting up a new server (after I tried and failed to upgrade a very old one, there were rabbitmq/erlang errors I didn't understand, and thought it'd be easier to do a new install) on Ubuntu 18.04. The docs at https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/requirements.html say this is supported but when I run the installed it isn't:

Unsupported OS release: bionic

Zulip in production is supported only on:
 - Ubuntu 14.04 LTS "trusty"
 - Ubuntu 16.04 LTS "xenial"

For more information, see:
  https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/requirements.html
Oh, that's the latest docs, not the last release docs, they only mention 16.04. Nevermind, I'll wait for the next release...
@Laurence Darby we're actually posting a release candidate in the next day or two; just clone the repo and install from there and you can beta-test.
(master is quite stable since we're gearing up for a release)
